alert.note: Alert for Catron; Cibola; McKinley; San Juan (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 26 at 9:28AM MST until February 26 at 9:45AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM MST FOR SOUTHWESTERN CIBOLA...WESTERN MCKINLEY...WESTERN CATRON AND SOUTHWESTERN SAN JUAN COUNTIES... At 928 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Toadlena to 13 miles south of Zuni Pueblo to 8 miles southwest of San Francisco Plaza, moving east and northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 1 and 37. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 0 and 38. Locations impacted include... Gallup, Zuni Pueblo, Reserve, Luna, Nakaibito, Fence Lake, Quemado, Vanderwagen, Yah-Ta-Hey and Aragon. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow down and turn on headlights! The visibility will suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
